Note:
Cf. Hendyng, stanza 29 (3383); Tilley (1950)
XTilley, Morris Palmer. A Dictionary of the Proverbs in England in the 16th and 17th Centuries. Ann Arbor, MI: University of Michigan, 1950 H554.

RylandsLat394.Transcription:
Dere is þat hony boutþat on þe þorn is I
                    souȝt
RylandsLat394.Note:
Written as one line; trans. ‘Mel male mercatur de spinis si
                        capiatur’, which follows.
RylandsLat394.Editions:
Pantin,  William A. 
             “A Medieval Collection of Latin and English Proverbs…from Rylands
                Latin MS. 394.” 
             Bulletin of the John Rylands Library
         14 (1930): 81-114: 100.
Sisam,  Celia,  and  Kenneth Sisam, eds.  
             The Oxford Book of Medieval English Verse.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1970: 560.
